means: 布莱克（姓氏； Hugo La Fayette, 1886-1971，美国法学家）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都含有"完全地或不完全地缺少光亮"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: dark, dim, black, gloomy, obscure, vague, grey
means: dark ： 最普通用词，指缺乏自然光线或人工照明，使某物漆黑无光或光线十分微弱。
dim ： 指光线不足或视力较差，不能清晰地看见物体。
black ： 侧重颜色是黑色的，有时也指无光的黑暗。
gloomy ： 指光线不足或部分光线受阻而出现的阴暗。
obscure ： 指因光线不充足而使物体灰暗不清，失去光泽或若隐若现。作借喻时指因复杂、深奥或含糊而难于理解。
vague ： 通常作借喻用，形容抽象事物。
grey与dark意思相近，但侧重阴暗单调的意味。

example.en: He blacked out at the sight of his own blood.
example.zh: 他一看见 自己的血就晕倒了。

example.en: I totally blacked out that evening.
example.zh: 那天晚上的事我一点都不记得了。

list.explanation: 不(向某区)播送电视(尤指体育比赛节目)

example.en: The whole region was blacked out for the final game.
example.zh: 电视不向全区播放这场决赛的实况。

list.explanation: 暗款，匿报的非法收益(也指偷税漏税的收入)，不义之财

example.en: Money that derives from an illegal transaction is considered" dirty" or" black " cash.
example.zh: 从非法交易来的钱被视为"赃钱"或者"不义之财"。

word_mean: 黑色的：不能反射光或真实颜色的

means.word_mean: 黑色的（以幽默的方式对待讨厌的或可怕的事物，如凶杀）
邪恶的；坏透的；昧良心的
郁闷的，忧郁的，阴郁的，悲观的；感伤的；阴沉的；令人无限悲哀的
坏透的，极可恶的，敌意的，非常不友善的，邪恶的，恶劣的；不义的；不可饶恕的，不可原谅的，应受惩罚的，应受谴责的
不名誉的，不光彩的，不光荣的，丢脸的；遭责难的
灾难性的；损失惨重的；灾难深重的，暗无天日的；带来重大不幸的；发生重大不幸事件的；不吉利的
毫无希望的，无望的；暗淡的
根深蒂固的，积习很深的，顽固不化的
(戏剧等作品)以病态绝望笔调揭露阴暗面的；以乖张悖理手法表现的
富于幽默的，诙谐的；好挖苦的
黑市的；非法交易的；违反经济法规的
【冶金学】(钢铁等)未抛光的，毛坯的

entry.def: Something that is black is of the darkest colour that there is, the colour of the sky at night when there is no light at all.

example.ex: She was wearing a black coat with a white collar...
example.tran: 她穿着一件白领黑外套。

example.ex: He had thick black hair...
example.tran: 他的头发乌黑浓密。

entry.def: A black person belongs to a race of people with dark skins, especially a race from Africa.
entry.tran: （人）黑色人种的；（尤指）非洲黑人的

example.ex: He worked for the rights of black people...
example.tran: 他为争取黑人权利而工作。

example.ex: Sherry is black, tall, slender and soft-spoken.
example.tran: 谢里是个黑人，身材高挑，细声细语。

entry.def: Black people are sometimes referred to as blacks. This use could cause offence.

example.ex: There are about thirty-one million blacks in the US.
example.tran: 美国大约有3,100万黑人。

entry.def: Black coffee or tea has no milk or cream added to it.

example.ex: A cup of black tea or black coffee contains no calories...
example.tran: 一杯不加牛奶的茶或咖啡不含热量。

example.ex: I drink coffee black.
example.tran: 我喝咖啡不加奶。

entry.def: If you describe a situation as black, you are emphasizing that it is very bad indeed.
entry.tran: 极糟糕的；坏透顶的；黑暗的

example.ex: It was, he said later, one of the blackest days of his political career...
example.tran: 后来他说，这是他政治生涯中最黑暗的日子之一。

example.ex: The future for the industry looks even blacker.
example.tran: 这个产业的前景看起来更加暗淡。

entry.def: If someone is in a black mood, they feel very miserable and depressed.

example.ex: In late 1975, she fell into a black depression...
example.tran: 在1975年底，她陷入了情绪的低谷。

example.ex: Her mood was blacker than ever.
example.tran: 她的心情从未如此低落过。

entry.def: You use black to describe things that you consider to be very cruel or wicked.

example.ex: I think their crime is a blacker one than mere exploitation.
example.tran: 我想他们的罪行比单纯的剥削更残忍。

example.ex: ...the blackest laws in the country's history.
example.tran: 这个国家历史上最严酷的法律

entry.def: Black humour involves jokes about sad or difficult situations.

example.ex: 'So you can all go over there and get shot,' he said, with the sort of black humour common among British troops here...
example.tran: “所以你们都可以到那里去挨枪子儿，”他说道，口吻中透着这里英国部队惯用的黑色幽默。

example.ex: It's a black comedy of racial prejudice, mistaken identity and thwarted expectations.
example.tran: 这是一个关于种族歧视、身份错位和期望落空的黑色喜剧。

entry.def: People who believe in black magic believe that it is possible to communicate with evil spirits.

example.ex: He was also alleged to have conducted black magic ceremonies...
example.tran: 据称他还做了法。

example.ex: The King was unjustly accused of practising the black arts.
example.tran: 国王被诬陷施行妖术。

entry.def: If someone blacks another person's eye, they punch or hit that person in the eye, causing it to bruise and look black.

example.ex: Her husband blacked her eye...
example.tran: 她丈夫把她的眼睛打青了。

example.ex: Their mother was trying to hide her two blacked eyes.
example.tran: 他们的母亲想遮住自己被打青的双眼。

entry.def: If you say that someone is black and blue, you mean that they are badly bruised.

example.ex: Whenever she refused, he'd beat her black and blue...
example.tran: 只要她拒绝他，他就会把她打得青一块紫一块。

example.ex: Bud's nose was still black and blue.
example.tran: 巴德的鼻子还是青一块紫一块的。

entry.def: If a person or an organization is in the black, they do not owe anyone any money.

example.ex: Remington's operations in Japan are now in the black...
example.tran: 雷明顿在日本的业务现在有盈利。

example.ex: Until his finances are in the black I don't want to get married.
example.tran: 在他有银行存款之前，我不想和他结婚。

entry.def: If someone gives you a black look, they look at you in a way that shows that they are very angry about something.

example.ex: Passing my stall, she cast black looks at the amount of stuff still unsold.
example.tran: 她经过我的货摊的时候，怒气冲冲地看了几眼还没有卖出去的东西。

means.word_mean: 1. the quality or state of the achromatic color of least lightness (bearing the least resemblance to white)
4. black clothing (worn as a sign of mourning);
1. being of the achromatic color of maximum darkness; having little or no hue owing to absorption of almost all incident light;
2. of or belonging to a racial group having dark skin especially of sub-Saharan African origin;

sentences.sentence: "a great people--a black people--...injected new meaning and dignity into the veins of civilization"- Martin Luther King Jr.

means.word_mean: 3. marked by anger or resentment or hostility;
4. stemming from evil characteristics or forces; wicked or dishonorable;

sentences.sentence: "his black heart has concocted yet another black deed"
"the scheme of some sinister intelligence bent on punishing him"-Thomas Hardy
"Life in the Aran Islands has always been bleak and difficult"- J.M.Synge

means.word_mean: 6. (of events) having extremely unfortunate or dire consequences; bringing ruin;

sentences.sentence: "the stock market crashed on Black Friday"
"the battle was a disastrous end to a disastrous campaign"
"such doctrines, if true, would be absolutely fatal to my theory"- Charles Darwin
"it is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it"- Douglas MacArthur

means.word_mean: 7. (of the face) made black especially as with suffused blood;

sentences.sentence: "fun ranging from slapstick clowning ... to savage mordant wit"

means.word_mean: 12. (used of conduct or character) deserving or bringing disgrace or shame;

sentences.sentence: "Man...has written one of his blackest records as a destroyer on the oceanic islands"- Rachel Carson
"his shirt was black within an hour"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  blæc, of Germanic origin

means: 布莱克（姓氏； Hugo La Fayette, 1886-1971，美国法学家）

sentences.en: Two black coffees, please.

sentences.en: a shiny black car

sentences.cn: 一项2001 年的研究记录了“黑人”这个词暗含的所有含义都要比“非裔美国人”更带贬义色彩。
sentences.en: A 2001 study  cataloged all the ways in which the term  “ Black ” carried connotations ( 涵 义 ) that were more negative than those of  “ African American. ”

sentences.cn: 现在已经知道“黑人”和“非裔美国人”会被区别对待了，但研究者至今还没有发现产生这样的认知差别的原因。
sentences.en: But if it was known that  “ Black ” people were viewed differently from  “ African Americans, ” researchers, until now, hadn ’ t identified what that gap in perception was  derived from ,
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 由埃默里大学Erika Hall 进行的最新的一项研究发现：“黑人”比“非裔美国人”更带有贬义色彩的原因是社会经济地位的明显不同。
sentences.en: A recent study, conducted by Emory University ’ s Erika Hall, found that  “ Black ” people are viewed more negatively than  “ African Americans ” because of a perceived difference in socioeconomic status.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 男：嗯，这是Shaun Harper的研究，他指出，全国的主要高校里，黑人男性占本科注册学生总数的比例不到3%。
sentences.en: M: Well, this is Shaun Harper’s study, and he points out that on major college campuses across the country, black males make up less than three percent of undergraduate enrollments.

sentences.cn: 女：与其他群体相比，我想， 在那65 所学校里，该群体的数据差不多就是，只有将将过半的黑人男性运动员毕业。

sentences.cn: 你爱这个黑人 吗 ?
sentences.en: Rod: Do you love this black man?

sentences.cn: 我父亲是白人,我母亲是黑人.
sentences.en: My father a white and my mother was black.

sentences.cn: 白人似乎比黑人更多就业工作.
sentences.en: White men are more likely to work than black men.

sentences.cn: 他没看见有些黑人尾随在他后面.
sentences.en: He didn't see some of the black folk trailing him.

sentences.cn: 布鲁斯音乐最初是由黑人演奏的.
sentences.en: The blues was / were first performed by the black people.

sentences.en: Rev Wright reminds many whites of everything they find alarming about black America.

sentences.cn: 在蓝调音乐的萌芽时期,黑人占了艺人与听众的绝对多数.
sentences.en: Both audience and player alike were predominantly Black for that gestation period.

sentences.cn: 在南部, 那里是黑人的土地, 他们种地为生, 是耕地的农民.
sentences.en: In the south, that's black people's land, where they live off the land , farming arable land.

sentences.cn: 或者, 用斯坦福大学的黑人心理学家克劳迪-M-斯蒂尔的话说, 这是一种“定型的脆弱性”.
sentences.en: Or, what Stanford University psychologist Claude M. Steele, who is black, refers to as'stereotype vulnerability.

sentences.cn: 然而注射安慰剂的黑人的感染率超过了8%.
sentences.en: This compared with an infection rate of more than 8 % in blacks given the placebo.

sentences.cn: 后来他说，这是他政治生涯中最黑暗的日子之一。
sentences.en: It was, he said later, one of the blackest days of his political career...

sentences.cn: 从月球看天空是一片黑暗.而你可以看见地球高高的挂在天上.
sentences.en: The sky looks black from the moon and you'll see earth up in the sky.

sentences.cn: 她直盯着洞里黑暗的世界,洞里的冰化成了水.
sentences.en: She stared into the cave's black interiors until water formed.

sentences.cn: 然后,黑暗压倒了我,我昏了过去.
sentences.en: Then the darkness overtook me and I blacked out.

sentences.cn: 我感到一片黑暗并准备自杀.
sentences.en: I was feeling black and ready to do myself in.

sentences.cn: 乌云迅速地聚集在森林那黑暗的边缘上.
sentences.en: Sullen clouds are gathering fast over the black fringe of the forest.

sentences.cn: 坦率地说, 4月6日对于商业界来说是黑暗的一天.
sentences.en: Quite frankly, April 6 will be a black day for business.

sentences.cn: 一切都将一次又一次地消逝于黑暗之中.
sentences.en: All shall fade to black again and again.

sentences.cn: 他们住在黑暗的地下, 穿着墨黑的衣服,就连皮肤也是泛着惨白的灰绿色,可他们的面容却与精灵一样美丽.
sentences.en: They live in the darkness of the earth, and adorn themselves in inky black clothing.

sentences.cn: 该屏幕瞬间变成一片黑暗.
sentences.en: The screen will go black for a second.

sentences.cn: 在这条河流中一切都将归于黑暗.
sentences.en: In this river all shall fade to black.

sentences.cn: 在这剧本里,一切都是黑暗的, 而且所有人都表现出恶魔Mephistopheles的性格.
sentences.en: Everything is black in it, and every one appeared to have Mephistopheles'character.

sentences.cn: 停电了;到处一片黑暗.
sentences.en: The electricity failed and everything was blacked out.

sentences.cn: 纳特拉: 你的心和我一样黑暗.
sentences.en: Natla: Your heart is as black as mine.

sentences.cn: 你们离去的日子指日可待了,黑暗的兄弟们.
sentences.en: Your days of secession are numbered black brothers.

sentences.cn: 而他的光辉夺目的太阳明明是在黑暗的晦蚀中消损.
sentences.en: And his marvelous sun was waning apparently to a black eclipse.

sentences.cn: 刺穿你高尚的处女膜,远离黑暗?
sentences.en: Broken hymen of your highness I'm left black?

sentences.en: A haze of red dots swarmed in the black of space and slowly drifted toward them.

sentences.cn: 兽人被击退到黑色沼泽的黑暗之门外围.
sentences.en: The Orcs are pushed back to the brink of the Dark Portal on the Black Morass.

sentences.cn: 西里斯?布拉克在黑暗之塔最高的房间里.
sentences.en: Sirius Black is in the topmost cell of the Dark Tower.

sentences.en: The stone glares down at us out of the black boundlessness, a memento mori.

sentences.en: The stage was blacked out a while and actors spoke in darkness.

sentences.cn: 后来他说，这是他政治生涯中最黑暗的日子之一。

sentences.en: Blacken'is a causative verb meaning cause to become black '.

sentences.en: The blacks were solid in their support of the boycott.

sentences.en: Alexander is a racist who refuses to employ blacks.

sentences.en: The ship was blacked by strikers.

sentences.en: He is a racist who refuses to employ blacks.

sentences.cn: 他们拒绝为一家不肯付合理工资的公司工作.
sentences.en: They blacked a firm that refused to pay proper wages.

sentences.cn: 而且令他沮丧的是, 当地的黑人大学竟拒绝杰米申请奖学金.
sentences.en: And to his dismay, the local black college turned Jamie down for a scholarship.

sentences.en: They protested against entering the Black Maria.

sentences.en: Black Furies : It is not right to deny your father and love only your mother.

sentences.en: The committee gave him a black eye , they turned down his suggestion.

sentences.en: John Lennon and Yoko Ono attend the Festival. Like Picasso, they eschew black tie.

sentences.cn: 他们拒绝了成百的歌迷.
